Articles.Content: Can you attach an ISA mapsat to a plane and map accurately this way?
That could be done, but you'd have to carry a lot of fuel to map the whole planet.
Yeah you'd need a ton of fuel and multiple trips but its possible. Satellites are a lot easier.
Yes a lot of fuel and a working version of mapsat, good luck on that one. But seriously if someone knows of a up to date version could you point me in that direction
In principle yes, but I recall mapsat causing ferocious lag at low altitudes, so it may not be practical. It would also be much slower than launching a satellite.
